utterance: If the pest does not get to a player, all the money in their wallet will be converted into a bonus in the end.
The more farmers contribute to the collective, the lesser the probability of pest spreading.
When the pest arrives to a farm, it gets destroyed and that farmer loses the game. This implies that remaining farmers need to contribute more to the collective to prevent pest spreading.
When a player reaches the final year without being caught by the pest, the coins in their wallet are converted into a bonus.
The number of coins collected each year impacts the probability of pest spreading.

A farmer loses the game when the pest gets to their tile. Having less farmers in the game means that the individual contributions to the collective have to be higher to maintain the risk of pest spreading.
